info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 5:25PM CDT until October 24 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Tom Green.
* WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 525 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Angelo, Christoval, Wall, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Lake Nasworthy, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Vancourt, Veribest, Knickerbocker, Tankersley, Mereta and Us-67 Near The Irion- Tom Green County Line. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Jackson From Knickerbocker to South Bryant, College Hills and Millbrook, Southwest Blvd and Loop 306, 1500 Block of Spaulding, FM 1692 crossing Concho River, Sul Ross At Red Arroyo Crossing, FM 2334 crossing Ninemile Creek, FM 2334 crossing Dry Lipan Creek, Huntington and Sunset and Huntington and Sunset. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you NWSSanAngelocan do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING
